formatted_address: 2 Adam Rd, #01-01 Adam Food Centre, Singapore 289876
name: No. 1 Adam's Nasi Lemak

reviews.text:
Long q because the service is slow very slow.
The only thing that stand out is the fried chicken wing .
Unable to add on other ingredients unless you opt for the $10 set which consist of wings , fish , otah.
Overall can eat but won’t q again.

If you’re craving for a good plate of nasi lemak with fried chicken, this is the place to go. Rice is fragrant, sambal is sweet, spicy & flavourful and the chicken is fresh, hot & juicy. The plate of nasi lemak also comes with the usual condiments- 2 slices of cucumber, ikan bilis, peanuts and an egg omelette.

I get why the place only has 3 stars- probably due to the long queue, slow-service or grumpy makcik but thats what you can expect during the busy lunch hour. I was lucky as I was 2nd in line and I managed to find a parking lot. Just order your nasi lemak with a smile and enjoy the food.

Overall, there’s no denying that it is one of the best places to eat nasi lemak in Singapore.
Avoid like a plague. The chicken set had hardly any ikan bilis and the egg was just a small slab. The server was also very slow.

The queue was short but the line goes a lot slower than the shop beside. Food wise, I thought it was just average. We couldn’t add extra chicken wings cause they were running out (I think the operations isn’t that good here)

Super
Long
Overrated
Wait

No nasi lemak is worth a 1 hour wait. Especially not this one. The rice flavour was too subtle, was too soft (I prefer it a bit firmer). Egg was normal, sambal wasn't special. The chicken was also very normal with uneven batter covering.

Too long wait for mediocre nasi lemak. Eat anything else.
